attributes.action: Consider the voice and opinion of the British People when ratifying the EU petition
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government have decided that it is in the interest of the people not to have a say, despite having earlier promising a referendum on Britain's place in Europe.

The Government's function is that of a mouthpiece for the people. Knowing the unpopular nature of, and strength of opinion against the Treaty, a motion was passed against a referendum on Wednesday, 5th March. 

The treaty brings us as close as is possible to the next stage of a united states of Europe - the constitution.

Whether or not you agree with the notion of a treaty for Europe, the petition is to test the real will of the people. I submit that it is patently wrong to mislead the people of Britain by the suggestion of a referendum for a constitution, but simply ignore the voice of the people with a matter of equal importance.

This is not a done deal. Ratification has not yet taken place and neither should it until such time as the people are permitted a rightful say.

I have no political affiliation, I am simply angered by what I consider to have been a breach of trust on the part of the Government.

Paul Nicholls.
